intro: Thlaspi praecox subsp. tricastanorum, commonly known as the early cabbages, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to central and southern Europe. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are pinnately divided. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, blooming in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. This subspecies is notable for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
